00025 void writeUp(int memCode1, int memCode2, ADDRS addr, int*& latency, int8_t*& data, memType rORw)
00026 {
00027         int8_t *tempData = (int8_t *) malloc(sizeof(int8_t)*8);
00028 
00029         if (memCode1 == 1 && memCode2 == 2) {
00030                 if(debug1) printf("   WU, memcCode:%d, addr = %llx\n", memCode1, addr);
00031                 doRead (L2, addr, data, latency, 2, 'R', rORw);
00032                 doWrite (L1, addr, data, latency, 1, rORw);
00033                 L1->setClean(addr); //reset the dirty flag
00034         } else if (memCode1 == 2 && memCode2 == 3) {
00035                 if(debug1) printf("   WU, memcCode:%d, addr = %llx\n", memCode1, addr);
00036                 doRead (L3, addr, data, latency, 3, 'R', rORw);
00037                 doWrite (L2, addr, data, latency, 2, rORw);
00038                 L2->setClean(addr); //reset the dirty flag
00039         } else if (memCode1 == 3 && memCode2 == 4) {
00040                 if(debug1) printf("   WU, memcCode:%d\n", memCode1);
00041                 //Skip actually writing into the memory (to avoid crazy mem. consumption)
00042                 doRead (L3, addr, data, latency, 4, 'R', rORw); //L2 is dummy... not being used or modified here
00043                 //Generate Random Data (TODO: this should be removed)
00044                 doWrite (L3, addr, data, latency, 3, rORw); //TODO this is WRONG and must be fixed
00045                 L3->setClean(addr); //reset the dirty flag
00046         }
00047         delete [] tempData;
00048 }
00049 
00050 void writeBack(int memCode1, int memCode2, ADDRS addr, int*& latency, memType rORw) {
00051         int8_t *tempData = (int8_t *) malloc(sizeof(int8_t)*8);
00052 
00053         if (memCode1 == 1 && memCode2 == 2) {
00054                 ADDRS tempAddr = L1->getWBAddr(addr);
00055                 if(debug1) printf("   WB, memcCode:%d - ADDRS:%llx\n", memCode1, addr);
00056                 doRead (L1, tempAddr, tempData, latency, 1, 'W', rORw);
00057                 doWrite (L2, tempAddr, tempData, latency, 2, rORw);
00058                 L1->setClean(addr); //reset the dirty flag
00059                 delete [] tempData;
00060         } else if (memCode1 == 2 && memCode2 == 3) {
00061                 ADDRS tempAddr = L2->getWBAddr(addr);
00062                 if(debug1) printf("   WB, memcCode:%d\n", memCode1);
00063                 doRead (L2, tempAddr, tempData, latency, 2, 'W', rORw);
00064                 doWrite (L3, tempAddr, tempData, latency, 3, rORw);
00065                 L2->setClean(addr); //reset the dirty flag
00066                 delete [] tempData;
00067         } else if (memCode1 == 3 && memCode2 == 4) {
00068                 //ADDRS tempAddr = L3->getWBAddr(addr);
00069                 if(debug1) printf("   WB, memcCode:%d\n", memCode1);
00070                 //Skip actually writing into the memory (to avoid crazy mem. consumption)
00071                 //doRead (L2, tempAddr, tempData, latency, 2, 'W', rORw);
00072                 //doWrite (L3, tempAddr, tempData, latency, 3, rORw);
00073                 L3->setClean(addr); //reset the dirty flag
00074                 delete [] tempData;
00075         }
00076 }

00079 int doRead(cache *L, ADDRS addr, int8_t*& data, int*& latency, int memCode, char type, memType rORw)
00080 {
00081         //if(memCode > hitLevel) hitLevel = memCode;
00082         if(debug1) printf("Onto Reading L%d - ADDRS=%llx\n", memCode,addr); 
00083         if (memCode <= 3) {
00084                 if (L->isValid(addr)) {
00085                         if (L->isHit(addr)) {
00086                                 if(debug1) printf("   R, V, H\n");
00087                                 if(memCode > hitLevel && rORw == READ) hitLevel = memCode;
00088                                 L->readCache(addr, data);
00089                                 return 0; //Cache Hit
00090                         } else {
00091                                 if(L->isDirty(addr)) {
00092                                         if(debug1) printf("   R, V, M, D\n");
00093                                         //if(debug1) printf("   ** why dirty: %x\n", L->getTag(addr)); //TODO getTag must go back to being provate...
00094                                         if (type == 'W') printf("      ADDRESSSSSSSS %llx\n", addr);
00095                                         writeBack(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, rORw);
00096                                         if (type == 'R') {writeUp(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, data, rORw);}
00097                                 } else {
00098                                         if(debug1) printf("   R, V, M, C\n");
00099                                         writeUp(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, data, rORw);
00100                                 }
00101                                 L->readCache(addr, data);
00102                                 return 0; //Cache miss (conflict) - check for dirtiness
00103                         }
00104                 } else {
00105                         if(debug1) printf("   R, I\n");
00106                         writeUp(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, data, rORw);
00107                         if (memCode == 1) L->readCache(addr, data);
00108                         return 0; //Cache miss (compulsary) (fetch-> read)
00109                 }
00110         } else {
00111                 if(memCode > hitLevel && rORw == READ) hitLevel = memCode; //TODO can a write ever make it here?
00112                 //We don't care about the number from DRAM. So gen a rand val
00113                 if(debug1) printf("   R, L4\n");
00114                 if(debug1) printf("   Data to Write: ");
00115                 //for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00116                 //{
00117                 //    data[i] = rand() % 100 + 1;
00118                 //    if(debug1) printf("%d ", data[i]);
00119                 //}
00120                 if(debug1) printf("\n");
00121         }
00122         return 0;
00123 }
00124 
00125 
00126 int doWrite(cache *L, ADDRS addr, int8_t*& data, int*& latency, int memCode, memType rORw)
00127 {
00128         //if(memCode > hitLevel) hitLevel = memCode;
00129         if(debug1) printf("Onto Writing L%d - ADDRS=%llx\n", memCode, addr); 
00130         if (memCode <= 3) {
00131                 if (L->isValid(addr)) {
00132                         if (L->isHit(addr)) {
00133                                 if(debug1) printf("   W, V, H\n");
00134                                 L->writeCache(addr, data);
00135                                 return 0; //Cache Hit (no care for dirty flag)
00136                         } else {
00137                                 //int8_t *inData = (int8_t *) malloc(sizeof(int8_t)*8);
00138                                 //for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {inData[i] = data[i];}
00139                                 if (L->isDirty(addr)) {
00140                                         if(debug1) printf("   W, V, M, D\n");
00141                                         if(debug1) printf("   ** why dirty: %llx\n", L->getTag(addr));
00142                                         writeBack(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, rORw);
00143                                         writeUp(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, data, rORw); //TODO fix? need it?
00144                                         //Cache Miss (writeback -> fetch -> write)
00145                                         L->writeCache(addr, data);
00146                                 } else {
00147                                         if(debug1) printf("   W, V, M, C\n");
00148                                         if (L->getExpectData(addr) == false) {
00149                                                 L->setExpectData(addr,true);
00150                                                 writeUp(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, data, rORw);
00151                                                 L->setExpectData(addr,false);
00152                                                 L->writeCache(addr, data);
00153                                         } else {
00154                                                 L->writeCache(addr, data);
00155                                         }
00156                                         //Cache Miss (fetch -> write)
00157                                 }
00158                                 return 0;
00159                         }
00160                 } else {
00161                         if(debug1) printf("   W, I\n");
00162                                         //writeUp(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, data, rORw); //TODO: should not need it
00163                         if (L->getExpectData(addr) == false) {
00164                                 L->setExpectData(addr,true);
00165                                 writeUp(memCode, memCode+1, addr, latency, data, rORw);
00166                                 L->setExpectData(addr,false);
00167                                 L->writeCache(addr, data);
00168                         } else {
00169                                 L->writeCache(addr, data);
00170                         }
00171                         return 0; //Cache Miss (fetch -> write)
00172                 }
00173         } else {
00174                 if(debug1) printf("   W, L4\n");
00175                 return 0;
00176         }
00177 }

00180 void report (ADDRS addr, int8_t*& data, int*& latency, memType rORw) {}
00181 
00182 int cacheCtrl (ADDRS addr, memType rORw, int*& latency, FILE * outFile, cache *_L1, cache *_L2, cache *_L3) //TODO is data declared correctly?
00183 {
00184         L1 = _L1;
00185         L2 = _L2;
00186         L3 = _L3;
00187         int result; //default
00188         // initialize random seed
00189         srand ( time(NULL) );
00190 
00191         //Generate Random Data (TODO: this should be removed)
00192         int8_t *data = (int8_t *) malloc(sizeof(int8_t)*8);
00193         int8_t *inData = (int8_t *) malloc(sizeof(int8_t)*8);
00194         //for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {inData[i] = 0;}
00195         
00196         //printf("cache address = %x\n", &L2);
00197 
00198         /*----Handle READS & WRITES----*/
00199         if (rORw == READ) { //Handle READ
00200             //printf("----READ: addr = %x\n", addr);
00201             hitLevel = 1;
00202             result = doRead(L1, addr, data, latency, 1, 'R', rORw);
00203             //return getLatency(hitLevel);
00204             //if (lineNum >= 71272839)
00205             //    fprintf(outFile, "%d,%lx\n", getLatency(hitLevel), addr);
00206         } else if (rORw == WRITE) { //Handle WRITE
00207             //printf("----WRITE: addr = %x\n", addr);
00208             hitLevel = 1;
00209             result = doWrite(L1, addr, inData, latency, 1, rORw);
00210             hitLevel = 1;//Hack to make write always a hit!
00211             //return getLatency(hitLevel);
00212             //if (lineNum >= 71272839)
00213             //    fprintf(outFile, "%d,%lx\n", getLatency(hitLevel), addr);
00214         } else {
00215             printf("WARNING: the memory access type is not specified\n");
00216             return -1;
00217         }
00218 
00219         delete [] data;
00220         delete [] inData;
00221         if(hitLevel == 0) printf("ERROR: hit level is 0\n");
00222         Assert (hitLevel != 0);
00223         if (debug1) printf("***********DONE MEM OP****************\n");
00224         return  getLatency(hitLevel, 0);
00225 }
